p: Inhibition of viral protein synthesis by Glycyrrhizae radix and Cnidii rhizome was also examined. MDCK(+) cells were infected with influenza virus at an m.o.i. of 5 and cultured in the presence of the crude drugs at various concentrations. At 7â€‰h after infection, proteins were pulse-labeled with 35S-Cys and -Met for 20 minutes and immunoprecipitated with an anti-influenza virus antibody. Glycyrrhizae radix specifically inhibited viral protein synthesis without affecting overall cellular protein synthesis ( Figure 9). Only the M1 protein is shown in the figure, but similar results were obtained for other viral proteins (data not shown). On the other hand, Cnidii rhizoma did not inhibit viral protein synthesis.
